New Records: Jarren Duran is the first player since at least 1901 to record 40 doubles, 10 triples, 20 home runs, and 30 stolen bases in a season.
Key Match Events: The Red Sox snapped a four-game losing streak with a 6-3 win over the Blue Jays.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Alex Cora switched up the routine on Tuesday, cutting back on the pregame work for his players, which helped the Red Sox respond with a win.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory pulled the Red Sox to within four games of the Twins for the final wild-card spot with 30 games remaining. Manager Alex Cora discussed Rafael Devers' shoulder soreness and his plans to manage his workload.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brayan Bello, who has posted one win in his last seven starts, will take the mound for the Sox.
The Red Sox have scored five or more runs 67 times, third most in MLB behind the Diamondbacks and Yankees.
Bello is 2-4 with a 6.96 ERA in seven career starts against Toronto.
Chris Bassitt will pitch for the Blue Jays with a 9-12 record and 4.41 ERA.
The lineups for both teams include several key players such as Vladimir Guerrero Jr., Wilyer Abreu, and Masataka Yoshida.
